moonsbox

A sandbox cellular automata playground. Inspired by classic falling sand games, especially SmellyMoo's sand:box, moonsbox lets you experiment with different materials and their interactions in a pixel world.

Features

  • Material Palette: Choose materials with a visual palette
  • Heat Simulation: Materials exchange temperature
  • Sound Effects: Some materials play sounds on interaction
  • Resizable Window: Zoom and pan the simulation area
  • Saving & Screenshots: Save your creations and take screenshots

Controls

Action Control
Draw with selected material LMB, Ctrl (Hold)
Move camera RMB, Shift (Hold)
Zoom camera Mouse Wheel
Open/Close material palette MMB, Tab
Pause simulation Space
Change view (Normal / Thermal) V
Step simulation (useful when paused) F5
Clear the map F6
Take a screenshot F10
Increase/Decrease brush size +/- Keys, Alt + Mouse Wheel
Pause rendering (for faster simulation) R (hold)
Start/Stop recording Alt + F12
Push current material to stack U, Mouse Forward Button
Pop material from stack (if the stack is empty, get Space) I, Mouse Back Button
Pick the material of a dot under the mouse cursor K

Running

To run, simply execute moonsbox.exe.

You can customize the game by editing user/config.toml. Comments inside the file will guide you.

Capturing

You can record your simulation! Press Alt + F12 to start/stop. Frames are saved as images.

To create a video from these images, you'll need FFmpeg:

  1. Download FFmpeg: ffmpeg.org/download
    Windows installing instruction:
    • Go to site above
    • Hover on Windows picture and go to "Windows builds from gyan.dev"
    • Download from link "ffmpeg-git-essentials.7z"
  2. Extract the archive and open the bin folder in File Explorer
  3. Hold Shift, right-click in the folder, and select "Open PowerShell window here"
  4. Use a command like this (replace CAPTURE_FOLDER with your actual folder name):
    ffmpeg -framerate 30 -i CAPTURE_FOLDER/frame_%06d.png my-video.mp4
